pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

We change the definition of the finite adeles to a subtype, and rework the original construction to be a subalgebra with this underlying subtype. We then show that the finite adeles are an algebra over the finite integral adeles, in an attempt to demonstrate that this set-up works fine.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9679858950/job/26706725839)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9679858950/job/26706727035)
maintainer merge
Thanks, two optional suggestions.
maintainer merge
Thanks, two optional suggestions.

I think the subalgebra should be separated into a new def, and `FiniteAdeleRing` could potentially be defined as `{ x : K_hat R K // x.IsFiniteAdele }` and only view it as a `subalgebra` (since they are defeq) when needed.
I'd just remove the coercion in FiniteAdeleRing and change its type to Subalgebra.

The problem with that is that `K_hat R K`, the thing it's a subalgebra of, is a technical intermediate thing, but `FiniteAdeleRing R K` is the fundamental definition and I think it deserves to be a type. There's a problem with having coerced terms as fundamental objects, and that's that typeclass inference goes crazy trying to deal with it. Here's the issue. We need to let `FiniteAdeleRing` be a type because it has, for example, a topology on it (and it's not the subspace topology coming from K_hat). So if it's a subalgebra then the code will be full of `↥FiniteAdeleRing`, and when typeclass sees that it wants e.g. a topological space structure on this, or a coercion from this to somewhere else, it is quick to start looking looking at the auxiliary object `K_hat` for answers. This leads to timeouts (we saw it with `↥(𝓞 K)` in the theory of number fields and people were complaining about timeouts for about a year) and this is exactly why we changed the definition of ring of integers from a term to a type (and it solved the problems!)
I see, thanks for the explanation!
I'm going to try erdOne's suggestion.

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion x.IsFiniteAdele ↔ {v | x v ∉ adicCompletionIntegers K v}.Finite := Iff.rfl ```
I think this lemma should go near the definition of `IsFiniteAdele`.
Why do you prefer to define this as a subtype, rather than a subalgebra?

If you look at the original version of this PR [here](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13705/commits/6a5c0f781c81f21d237dc0fed160ef38be1ab868#diff-e3f60199ddcf6fe696a3eed7602eded09cf575d804ab32af60be92b53c2cabb6R339-R347) you'll see what happens if you make it a coerced subalgebra; the `simp` lemma you need to get things back under control is horrible. Now we make it as a subtype and get the algebra structure via the subalgebra.

I think María Inés was asking why this isn't `def FiniteAdeleRing : Subalgebra K (K_hat R K)`. To quote Kevin from above:
> The problem with that is that `K_hat R K`, the thing it's a subalgebra of, is a technical intermediate thing, but `FiniteAdeleRing R K` is the fundamental definition and I think it deserves to be a type. There's a problem with having coerced terms as fundamental objects, and that's that typeclass inference goes crazy trying to deal with it. Here's the issue. We need to let `FiniteAdeleRing` be a type because it has, for example, a topology on it (and it's not the subspace topology coming from K_hat). So if it's a subalgebra then the code will be full of `↥FiniteAdeleRing`, and when typeclass sees that it wants e.g. a topological space structure on this, or a coercion from this to somewhere else, it is quick to start looking looking at the auxiliary object `K_hat` for answers. This leads to timeouts (we saw it with `↥(𝓞 K)` in the theory of number fields and people were complaining about timeouts for about a year) and this is exactly why we changed the definition of ring of integers from a term to a type (and it solved the problems!)

We should add a library note for this.

I think it would be good to add some remark along the following lines:
```suggestion
/-- The finite adèle ring of `R`, regarded as a `K`-subalgebra of the
product of the local completions of `K`.

Note that this definition exists to streamline the proof that the finite adèles are an algebra over `K`,
rather than to express their relationship to `K_hat R K` which is essentially a detail of their construction.
-/
```

Have I got this right:
```suggestion
of `adicCompletion`, with respect to `adicCompletionIntegers`.

Note that we make this a `Type` rather than a `Subtype` (e.g., a `subalgebra`) since we wish
to endow it with a finer topology than that of the subspace topology. -/
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: the finite adele ring is an algebra over the finite integral adeles.
